name: Deviled Eggs Chesapeake
author: Bob Miller
summary: Eggs deviled with crab meat, seasoned with Old Bay® and dry mustard. If you like Maryland-style crab cakes, you'll love these deviled eggs.
ingredients: ½ cup water, or as needed
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan; cover with water
Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes
Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel
Cut each egg in half lengthwise
Place yolks in a bowl; mash yolks with a fork
Stir crab meat, oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons seafood seasoning, and dry mustard into yolks; beat with an electric mixer on low speed to combine
Add water gradually to egg yolk mixture and increase mixer speed slowly, beating until smooth
Place egg whites on a serving platter
Spoon yolk mixture into egg whites; sprinkle with seafood seasoning
